channel.title: How to add mac compatibility?
channel.description:
Hey all,
So I am running my server and some guys are asking me to put a mac compatibility, so they can play it as well. But I have no clue how to do it. I have no experience with mac..
So i believe everything is client sided which means i'll have to re-jar & re-upload everything. 317 PI sources.
If someone could help me it would be appreciated.

item.title: How to add mac compatibility?
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

I’d like to ask… Do you NEED to do the + fs + thing? I thought about doing it but it takes so long to find out where the "/"s are…

Read full topic

item.title: How to add mac compatibility?
item.dc:creator: @torn_miller torn miller
item.description:
@torn_miller wrote:

Not sure if this will work then… I’ve never tried this.

Try making a copy of all the files. Do what I said above, and then run both at the same time, that way it’ll have the same no-ip directory.

Read full topic

item.title: How to add mac compatibility?

item.description:
@kawfan wrote:

lol, i don’t want to make my rsps exclusively for mac’s…

item.title: How to add mac compatibility?
item.dc:creator: @torn_miller torn miller
item.description:
@torn_miller wrote:

try this, if it doesn’t work, sorry, no idea…

  1. Open signlink class.
    Replace your method “findcachedir” with:

public static String findcachedir() { String fs = System.getProperty("file.separator"); String as[] = { System.getProperty("user.home") }; if(storeid < 32 || storeid > 34) storeid = 32; String s = "XelphoriaCaches"; //Change the name here for the cache name for(int i = 0; i < as.length; i++) try { String s1 = as[i]; if(s1.length() > 0) { File file = new File(s1); if(!file.exists()) continue; } File file1 = new File(s1 + fs + s); if(file1.exists() || file1.mkdir()) return s1 + fs + s + fs; } catch(Exception _ex) { } return null; }

  1. In all files (RSInterfaces, Animation, client, Sprite, class36, ect) where you hardcoded your interfaces, icons, ect, you need to replace all “/” slashes with:

You also need to declare this each time you use “+ fs +”:

Here’s an example:

String fs = System.getProperty("file.separator"); (fs + "Sprites" + fs + "Bank" +fs +id + s);

Your cache will now be downloaded there: the C:/Users/You/Cache instead of C:/Cache.

Read full topic
